intro: Sapium brasiliense, commonly known as Brazilian wild chenopod, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
